text: The Church of St Peter in Old Market Street, Blackley, Manchester, England, is a Gothic Revival church of 1844 by E. H. Shellard. It was a Commissioners' church erected at a cost of £3162. The church is particularly notable for an almost completely intact interior. It was designated a Grade II* listed building on 20 June 1988. The church is of "coursed sandstone rubble with ashlar dressings". The nave has buttresses and "clumsy" pinnacles and ends in a "blunt" west tower. The interior is aisled and "particularly impressive for its complete (nineteenth century) interior with the extremely unusual survival of all the fine boxes and other pews". The churchyard contains the war graves of ten service personnel of World War I and seven of World War II. CWGC Cemetery Report. ==See also== *Grade II* listed buildings in Greater Manchester *Listed buildings in Manchester-M9 ==References== ===Bibliography=== * Category:Grade II* listed churches in Manchester Category:Churches in Manchester Category:Church of England church buildings in Greater Manchester Category:Commissioners' church buildings Category:Churches completed in 1844 Category:19th-century Church of England church buildings
title: Church of St Peter, Blackley
